subsection_analysis.refined_text: Marseille was founded by Greek sailors around 600 BC. The Old Port has been a bustling harbor for over 2,600 years. The Basilica of Notre-Dame de la Garde is perched on a hill overlooking the city. Le Panier is the oldest district in Marseille. The city hosts several festivals throughout the year.

subsection_analysis.document: South of France - Tips and Tricks.pdf
subsection_analysis.refined_text: Packing tips and tricks include layering, multi-purpose shoes, reusable bags, a portable laundry kit, a first aid kit and a list of emergency contacts, including local embassy or consulate information.    For more packing tips, visit packing.com.

subsection_analysis.document: South of France - Tips and Tricks.pdf
subsection_analysis.refined_text: Packing tips and tricks include layering, multi-purpose shoes, reusable bags, a portable laundry kit, a first aid kit and a list of emergency contacts, including local embassy or consulate information.    For more packing tips, visit packing.com.

subsection_analysis.document: South of France - Tips and Tricks.pdf
subsection_analysis.refined_text: Packing for a trip to the South of France involves considering the season, planned activities, and the needs of both adults and children. Remember to pack light, versatile clothing, and essential items to make the most of your travel experience.

subsection_analysis.document: South of France - Tips and Tricks.pdf
subsection_analysis.refined_text: Plan your wine tour route in advance and consider hiring a driver or joining a guided tour to avoid drinking and driving. Make a packing list and use packing cubes to organize clothes and maximize space. Pack a day bag for daily excursions and a foldable bag for souvenirs.
